str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Grim, severe, strict, exacting, harsh, rigid. From a derivative of the same as aer; rough, i.e. severe.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To reap, gather, harvest. From theros; to harvest.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To sow, spread, scatter. Probably strengthened from spao; to scatter, i.e. Sow.
